page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our block is a rural area. It is all good farming land of various kinds, which hosts many old buildings containing vivid pasts and farms with traditional farming people. The B5030 runs across our area, next to a Victorian Post Box at Combridge, and also the ruins of Crakemarsh Hall, owned by J.C.Bamfords.The area hosts many farms which are described, along with Mince Pie Hall and Woodseat which was formerly a Garden Centre. The Staffordshire Way is also frequented by Hikers in our area. The River Dove flows through the block, and the land is undulating, but reaching a ridge peak in the east at 500 m. A disused railway track is also present across the block. Abbotsholme Independent School and its grounds are situated in the extreme east of the block, where many foreign students attend.
